response_data.primary_response:
I don’t have telemetry from your environment, so the current security status is unknown. To determine it quickly, run these high-signal checks and share the results (or tell me your SIEM/EDR so I can tailor commands):

Immediate triage (last 24 hours)
- SIEM: Count of High/Critical alerts, top 10 rules firing, and any repeated entities (host, user, IP).
- Identity/IAM: New privileged role assignments, MFA disabled/bypassed, new service principals or app consents.
- Authentication anomalies: Unusual geo/logon spikes, brute-force patterns, legacy auth use.
- EDR/AV: High-severity detections, quarantine failures, machines with sensor/AV disabled.
- Endpoint behavior: Suspicious LOLBins/PowerShell with encoded/base64 commands, script interpreters spawning network connections.
- Network/Proxy: Outbound connections to newly-seen domains, high-frequency beacons, TOR/VPN egress, spikes to rare countries.
- Vulnerabilities: New Critical CVEs, public-facing assets with exploitable findings, deltas since last scan.
- Backups/DR: Last backup job status for critical systems, recent restore test results.
- Coverage/health: Percent of endpoints reporting to SIEM/EDR, data latency >30 min.

If you use Microsoft Sentinel (KQL)
- High/Critical alerts:
  SecurityAlert
  | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h) and Severity == "High"
  | summarize count() by ProviderName, AlertName, tostring(CompromisedEntity)
  | order by count_ desc
- New privileged role assignments:
  AuditLogs
  | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h) and OperationName has "Add member to role"
  | extend Role=tostring(TargetResources[0].displayName)
  | where Role has_any ("Global Administrator","Privileged Role Administrator","User Access Administrator")
  | project TimeGenerated, InitiatedBy=tostring(InitiatedBy.user.userPrincipalName), Role, Target=tostring(TargetResources[0].userPrincipalName)
- MFA disabled/changed:
  AuditLogs
  | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h) and OperationName has_any ("Update user","Disable Strong Authentication","Reset Strong Authentication")
  | project TimeGenerated, OperationName, InitiatedBy=tostring(InitiatedBy.user.userPrincipalName), Target=tostring(TargetResources[0].userPrincipalName), ResultDescription
- Sign-in geo anomalies (simple multi-country heuristic):
  SigninLogs
  | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)
  | summarize countries=make_set(LocationDetails.countryOrRegion) by UserPrincipalName
  | where array_length(countries) > 1
- Defender for Endpoint high severity:
  SecurityAlert
  | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h) and ProviderName =~ "MDATP" and Severity == "High"
  | summarize count() by AlertName, tostring(CompromisedEntity)
- Suspicious process execution:
  DeviceProcessEvents
  | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)
  | where ProcessCommandLine has_any (" -enc ", "FromBase64String", "DownloadString", "Invoke-WebRequest", "rundll32", "regsvr32", "mshta", "bitsadmin", "wscript.exe", "cscript.exe")
  | project TimeGenerated, DeviceName, InitiatingProcessAccountName, FileName, ProcessCommandLine
  | top 25 by TimeGenerated desc

If you use Splunk (SPL)
- High/Critical alerts:
  index=* (sourcetype=security:alert OR tag=attack) severity IN ("high","critical") earliest=-24h
  | stats count by source AlertName dest user
  | sort - count
- Privileged role changes (Azure AD example):
  index=o365 sourcetype="o365:management:activity" Operation="Add member to role" earliest=-24h
  | table _time Actor[].ID Target[].ID ModifiedProperties[].NewValue
- MFA changes (Azure AD):
  index=o365 sourcetype="o365:management:activity" earliest=-24h (Operation="Update user" OR Operation="Reset strong authentication" OR Operation="Disable Strong Authentication")
  | table _time Actor[].ID Target[].ID Operation ResultStatus
- Multi-country sign-ins:
  index=o365 sourcetype="azure:signin" earliest=-24h
  | stats dc(LocationDetails.countryOrRegion) as countries by UserPrincipalName
  | where countries>1
- EDR high severity (Defender example):
  index=mded earliest=-24h AlertSeverity=High
  | stats count by DeviceName ThreatName
- Suspicious processes:
  index=edr sourcetype=processes earliest=-24h
  | search (cmdline="* -enc *" OR cmdline="*FromBase64String*" OR cmdline="*Invoke-WebRequest*" OR process IN (rundll32.exe,regsvr32.exe,mshta.exe,bitsadmin.exe,wscript.exe,cscript.exe))
  | table _time host user process cmdline

What to send me
- Counts and top offenders from the above, plus any High/Critical alerts and their entities.
- Any recent privileged IAM changes and whether they were approved.
- Number of endpoints not reporting to EDR/SIEM and any disabled protections.
- Any Critical external-facing vulnerabilities detected since the last scan.
- Status of last backups for key systems.

With those, I can provide a clear status (Green/Amber/Red) and next actions. If you tell me your tooling (e.g., Sentinel, Splunk, QRadar, Defender, CrowdStrike, Okta), I’ll tailor exact queries and dashboards.
